samples.question: And are there any celebrations that you think should be more widely recognized?
samples.transcript: Yeah. I think the celebration that need to be widely recognized is like in my country in Indonesia like the Edel fritter is quite f famous in our country especially on in the countryside because people on the countryside usually more eager to celebrate the celebration rather than the one in the city. So I think it also need to be attract more people to experience the celebration. Okay.

Uh I think the celebration uh that need to be widely recognized is like uh in uh my country in Indonesia like the Edel fritter is quite uh f famous in our uh country especially on in the countryside because uh people on the countryside usually uh more uh eager to celebrate the celebration rather than the one in the city. So I think it also need to be uh uh attract more people to uh experience the celebration. Okay.

Always better to find the paraphrase than to struggle with trying to find that word. But on a human level, I fully understand when you have a word on the tip of your tongue when you that word it is really you just cannot think of that word. It can be frustrating. samples.question: Now, what are some common situations that require an apology?
samples.transcript: >> If we start from small situations like accidentally hitting a person, >> accidentally hitting a person is fine. bumping into a person maybe bit more natural but hitting accidentally hitting is fine >> or I do not know pushing a person on a crowded train then of course we say sorry if we talk about like bigger mistakes I think there could be some issues with misunderstanding among parents and their children among co-workers or teachers and students >> can we get a list of three things. >> In these situations when there is some misunderstanding, people have to apologize sometimes. >> Yeah. Perhaps, you know, if I am uber critical, I could say, well, give me a detail of that possible misunderstanding.

samples.question: What kind of misunderstandings could happen between parents and children?
samples.transcript: Of course, we have to be careful with the way that we manage our time because we know that we cannot speak forever and ever and ever. And these topics do have the scope to talk about them forever and ever and ever. And so we have to be careful what we do. But I I do think maybe a concrete example could be helpful.

samples.question: >> And do you think it is always easy for a person to apologize if they understand they have done something wrong?
samples.transcript: So certainly with higher level candidates, I like to dig deeper into what they say. So of course I have a list of questions but I tried to get those questions in in a way that feels like it is a discussion. So the candidate has said that people find it difficult to apologize because they cannot accept that they have done something wrong.
samples.transcript_original: So certainly with higher level candidates, I like to dig deeper into what they say. So of course I have a list of questions but I tried to get those questions in in a way that feels like it's a discussion. So the candidate has said that people find it difficult to apologize because they can't accept that they've done something wrong.
samples.transcript_cleaned: certainly with higher level candidates, I like to dig deeper into what they say. So of course I have a list of questions but I tried to get those questions in in a way that feels like it is a discussion. So the candidate has said that people find it difficult to apologize because they cannot accept that they have done something wrong.

samples.question: Is it logically therefore easy for them to apologize?
samples.transcript: And I like to do this because it puts a bit of extra cognitive load on the candidate.
samples.transcript_original: And I like to do this because it puts a bit of extra cognitive load on the candidate.
